title: DANGER WARNING: Spain, Turkey and Greece the most dangerous holiday destinations
text:
Tourists face balcony falls, roadside and station robberies, and swimming pool bugs in Spain GETTY The three countries have been highlighted as problem areas There literally is danger at every turn, be it in the pool or in your food Nick Harris, head of travel at Simpson Millar solicitors 
The solicitor highlighted specific Spanish issues including balcony falls, roadside and station robberies, and swimming pool bugs. 
He added: "Certain countries seem to have more than their fair share of accidents and illnesses. The map shows the places where we see the most incidents. 
"There literally is danger at every turn, be it in the pool, in your food, on the stairs or outside the front of your hotel. 
"A nasty stomach infection can attack the lining of the stomach, dehydration can affect the kidney and liver." 
But it's not just Spain to avoid, apparently. Holiday makers travelling to Greece were warned of moped and car accidents, sexual assault and violence on the streets. 
And in Turkey he claimed the 'major dangers' included slips, trips and water slide incidents. 
This falls in line with the Foreign Office's report stating more than 17,000 Brits have ended up in A+E abroad in the last five years. 
Tourists have ended up in hospital after being involved in accidents, illness or violence. 
Could this be the beginning of staycations for cautious Brits? New stats show, back in 2013, a huge 67 per cent of the nation decided to stay put during the holidays, and enjoy the sights of Britain. 
Just 32 per cent of people travelled abroad to enjoy the sunshine - and that figure could decrease after the recent revelation about former holiday favourites Spain and Greece. Related articles
